intro: Elatostema subfavosum, commonly known as the small white elatostema, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes nettle and related plants. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant, and it produces small, dry fruits. Elatostema subfavosum is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks.
